We arrived at Marco Polo at 9p.m by 10p.m we had checked in and were eating supper overlooking canal by hotel-magical.Rooms very pretty, not big, but comfortable.Breakfast plentiful. Very convenient for leaving luggage there when checking out.Would definetly stay there again, not cheap though.

Summarization.comm: The hotel is ideally located close to public transportation.

cont.entity_a: The hotel is ideally located in the center of Venice, close to excellent restaurants and water-ferry stations, away from the usual tourist traps, making it a perfect venue for a stay.
cont.entity_b: The hotel is ideally located in a quiet spot just a few minutes' walk from public transportation, including trains, buses, and the Vaporetto station, making it perfect for tourists, especially those on cruises, while St. Mark's Square is about an hour's walk away, and the airport is only 15 minutes away.

Summarization.comm: The rooms are decorated beautifully and provide a comfortable stay.

cont.entity_a: The hotel rooms are spacious, quiet, and decorated with a charming old-world style that respects history, while the bathrooms are modern and newly renovated, providing a comfortable stay overall, although the rooms can be somewhat cold.
cont.entity_b: The rooms in the hotel vary in size but tend to be small, though they are beautifully decorated with nice views of the canal, and thanks to the minimal noise, it’s pleasant to keep the windows and shutters open.

Summarization.comm: The staff are friendly and helpful.
Breakfast is basic.

cont.entity_a: Breakfast at the hotel is basic but satisfactory, offering a continental style with yogurts, cereals, coffee, and pastries.
cont.entity_b: The food at the hotel was okay but not exceptional; however, the breakfast was plentiful, and dining with a view overlooking the canal provided a magical experience.

Summarization.comm: The hotel was really clean.

cont.entity_a: the hotel provides great value for money.

cont.entity_b: The hotel looks exactly as advertised, with photos that accurately reflect its reality, living up to all the images and promises on its website.

entity_a_review: For all the germaphobics out there, this hotel is for you...       Outrigger Reef on the beach

Highly recommed We started our honeymoon on Waikiki beach and even though the Outrigger reef was under some construction, their hospitality and kindness made up for it. However we did have an Ocean view room which was near the construction but we asked to move to an Ocean front and they allowed us for a minor upgrade charge. Overall, I was very happy with the Outrigger, their dining, their hospitality and especially happy with the free gifts they gave us for staying there. Everything a hotel should do when you are trying to enjoy your honeymoon.

demolition site six nearby buidings are being demolished to make way for new timeshare apartments which makes relaxing by the pool uncomfortable .The noise from the breakers can be heard all over the hotel,so unless you like taking your holiday in the middle of a large building site, give this hotel a miss until 2007 when the projct is due for completion.

Poor service We had a very rough start to our stay in this hotel. We had booked a king room and were taken to a cramped room with no view and one double bed. When we complained, the staff said they had no rooms available that fit our confirmed reservation. They offered to give us a comparable room at a related hotel down the street, which turned out to be off the beach and much less nice than this hotel. We returned to reception to tell them the room was unacceptable and were eventually upgraded to a king room at the Outrigger Reef with a partial ocean view. Why they didn't do this first if they didn't have a regular king room I will never know, but it made us very grumpy to wait nearly two hours to get a room after a very long flight.The room was clean, but nothing special. It had a small outdoor patio, but overlooked the pool and many other patios, which made it very loud and not at all private.We would not stay here again.

Loved the Outrigger Reef! We stayed at the Outrigger for 4 nights on our honeymoon in October. They upgraded us to an ocean front room and brought us a bottle of champaign on our first night! This hotel is right on the beach and has 2 restuarants right on the beach in addition to a great place to eat at the pool along with the sports bar at the pool. We never had a problem getting a chair at the pool. We spent most of our days going back and forth from the ocean to the pool - there is also a little sandwich, ice cram and smoothie shop right next door that we would eat lunch at on the beach that is pretty cheap. It is on the far end of Waikiki, which we liked cause you are close to the action but also have some quiet. We will definitly stay here again when we return to Oahu.
A Fantastic Time!       Outrigger Reef Hotel

Loved the island- The Outrigger Reef was a very nice hotel. I did not however like the enforced valet parking. I was lead to believe we had to valet, but we could have parked on the upper level on our own, and still paid the $13 per day. From what I understand, it could have been worse, some hotels charged as much as $18 per day for parking. There are so many hotels, restaurants and shopping in this small area of Wikiki, that there is no parking space, so you pay dearly for having a car. Every place we went there were also tour busses that would do the same routes, but we did it at our leisure, and stayed at each site as long as we wanted. The next trip will be to another quieter less populated island. But the Island was absolutely breathtaking, expensive but breathtaking.

Handicap access We stayed at Outrigger Reef for 7 days in mid-May 2003 and would go back in a heart beat. I am blind/visually impaired and my sighted companion is wheelchair confined. We booked a handicapped access room and though a little small, the roll-in shower with bench was most comfortable and the room clean and airy with a balcony overlooking the pool and a partial ocen view.Breakfast each day was a delight pool side, with attentive courteous service. Ate dinner several nights in the hotel dining rooms and were very pleased.. Found an Italian restaurant across the street and dined there 2 nights as a change of pace. Tour amenities in the lobby were helpful, and the bell desk helped arrange transportation to Pearl Harbor and my Korean War vessel the Mighty USS Missouri. All in all a most enjoyable trip and the Outrigger Reef staff contributed greatly.Aloha!
entity_b_review: happy with the Queen Kap!       photo from our balcony

Nice stay This was a pretty nice hotel. The location was great and very convenient. The amenities were nothing fancy, but definitely adequate. We got a balcony that overlooked the city and ocean and a sizeable bathroom; I couldn't really ask for more. This is definitely not a luxury palace, but I doubt anyone booking this hotel expects that!

Would NEVER Stay There Again I booked this Queen as part of a package from Pleasant Hawaiian Holidays. The flight (Delta) was packed but ok. The room at the Queen REEKED of mold. We couldn't get another room, they claimed to be 100% full (actually, they told us they always overbook 3-5%).I took apart the air conditioner, cleaned out a bunch of black fungus/mold and bought a can of Lysol at ABC store for $8.It helped a little, but not much.I called Pleasant, they claimed they couldn't help me and that I was better off at the counter.If you stay here, remember you're paying $50/night in a $150 neighborhood and that the facility is old, moldy, overbooked, and that they don't have much for customer service.By the way, I think Pleasant Holidays is off my list too becase of their complete lack of support.

Getting Pretty Bad Liike every one has said , the location  view are wonderful , but then there's your room and the slow elevators. The rooms need a new face lift bad and the bathrooms are getting gross, I went to have breakfast with my family, and after waiting over 20 minutes for a elevator they where leaving the restraunt by the time I got there. And the tile around the pool is VERY SLIPPERY, my grandchildren fell many times. I would recommend this hotel only if it's all you can afford and you want to be close to the beach.

Can't Recomment This hotel is in need of a big makeover, standard rooms are really small, seems some motels have better rooms than their standard rooms. Service was good, but thats about it for this hotel.

A Good Deal Stayed for 4 nights and had a really good stay. Friendly, helpful staff. Tour/Activities staff in lobby very knowledgeable. Poor points are very limited parking and having to go to basement to get a pool towel from Housekeeping versus poolside on 3rd floor. The AC units chill your room quickly. Breakfast buffet good deal for the money and their dinners are just as good as any other restaurant. Excellent location (beach, zoo, aquarium, shopping, etc) and easy to find. Rooms are dated but clean and larger than you'd expect for the price. I would definitely stay there again and plan to do so!

Wonderful Value - Good for GLBT Customers If you are used to the Ritz-Carlton and the W Hotel, then this place is not for you. But, if you want a wonderful bargain right in the heart of Waikiki, this is great! And if you are a GLBT customer, you are right next door to Hula's and across the street from Queen's Surf Beach. I would definitely stay again. I got a great deal too. Stay 3 nights and get the 4th night free.

great hotel good value We stayed at Queen Kap for 11nights to the 09 sept 04. It was great we requested an ocean view studio with kitchenette. The room was on the 8th floor had a view of diamond head, beach, pool and zoo!! It was old but clean and very comfortable, and reasonably priced with every 5th night free and free buffets thrown in everyday too! Check their websites for specials. We will be staying there again its old but good and staff are friendly but request a room with a view and pay the extra! Mahalo

Summarization.comm: The hotel is conveniently located near the beach and close to shops.

cont.entity_a: The location is near the beach on the quieter far side of Waikiki, close to various dining options, shopping, and action, making it perfect for honeymooners and tourists interested in local attractions.
cont.entity_b: The hotel is conveniently located near a zoo and aquarium, among other tourist sights, and it's also close to shops, making it a great spot for those interested in both attractions and shopping.

Summarization.comm: The staff are generally friendly and provide good service.

cont.entity_a: The staff at the hotel were mostly very helpful, with the concierge assisting in arranging transportation to Pearl Harbor, and the bell desk also being helpful in organizing transport.
cont.entity_b: The staff at the hotel are generally friendly and knowledgeable, providing good service with a clear understanding of the area. However, there are some inconsistencies, as not all staff members are equally helpful, making the service overall satisfactory but not extraordinary.

Summarization.comm: The rooms offer views.

cont.entity_a: The room was clean with adequate disabled access, though it was small and it may take a while to get access; after receiving an upgrade due to the first room being unacceptable, the King-sized room offered partial ocean views and was okay, but nothing special; while the hotel is generally clean and a nice place, perfect for germaphobes, there were some concerns about cleanliness that could be improved, and occasional noise issues were noted.
cont.entity_b: The hotel rooms offer nice views of the city, Diamond Head, and the zoo, with some rooms overlooking the ocean as well. While the rooms and bathrooms are of adequate size, they could benefit from a deep clean. The impressive views unfortunately don't compensate for the tired decor and low standard of cleaning in some rooms, with issues like mold smells and the need for updates being noted in certain areas.

Summarization.comm: The hotel offers dining options and provides a buffet.

cont.entity_a: Dinner at the hotel was really good and pleasing, with the hotel's restaurants serving good food, and there are also a variety of other dining options nearby, including an Italian restaurant, along with two restaurants and a sports bar on offer at the hotel.
cont.entity_b: The hotel provides a complimentary buffet every day, which is a significant perk for guests. The daily free buffet is something guests should take full advantage of during their stay.

cont.entity_a: The hotel offers some peace and quiet while still being close to the action, though the small outdoor patio overlooking the pool and other patios can make it quite noisy, making the overall experience generally good but with some potential for noise disturbances.

The hotel offers valet and parking services, but they enforce valet parking, which some guests find off-putting; the valet parking is expensive, and the parking options could have been clearer, as it was implied that valet was enforced when self-parking was available.

cont.entity_b: The hotel has a deal where you get the fourth night free if you stay three nights, making it an attractive option for longer stays.
The hotel has a swimming pool, but the tiles around the pool are very slippery, which poses a hazard. Caution is advised when using this facility due to the risk of slipping.
While the hotel is not a luxury establishment, it still offers a good and affordable stay, making it a recommended option for those seeking value for money.
The hotel’s amenities are adequate, providing sufficient facilities for a comfortable stay, though they are not particularly luxurious.

entity_a_review: Stayed with friends on a business trip and the key to our room didnt work till after 6 attemps of the manager making new ones. it took 2 hours to get this sorted making us late for the important meeting we had and the deal fell through costing us a fortune. Next morning, the shower came alive and flew of the wall like a firemans hose, scallding each of us and having finally sorting this dangerous problem, we arrived 10 minutes late for breakfast and staff wouldnt serve us. staff then kept us waiting half an hour to check out with no real apoligy for our inconvieniences.staff very laid back and unintrested. All in all a big dissapointment. Scallding cobra shower very dangerous.BE WARNED

Don't fall for the scam of 'local tax' when checking out. Fifty euro deposit is taken when checking in for 'incidental' expenses. They then try and hold most of it back when you are leaving saying it is a local tax. We paid fully for our trip through a travel agent in UK before travelling so if the hotel have a problem with that they should take it up with them. Kick up a stink like we did and they will back down though. It makes you wonder how many people have been conned with this trick?

This hotel is exceptional. For a 3 star Euro hotel the rooms are huge, the views of the canal (Herengeraacht) outside are atmospheric, the location, despite being very quiet is a pleasant 10 minute stroll to Dam Square, and only 5 minutes to Anne Franks House. The staff were very helpful and friendly despite the fact we turned up at gone midnight a little wiped from our day in Amsterdam. For the price this hotel really is head and shoulders above its peers, which in Amsterdam can be very seedy. Always stay here when in the `Dam.

For this trip to 'the dam' we wanted to be a bit more central, and we hit jackpot with this hotel. Right next to a canal, its around 5 mins walk to Dam square, and the same to Jordaan or the Nine Little Lanes. Leidsplein and other more interesting parts are also just a short walk away. The hotel itself is ok, it has a grand entrance hall with a reception desk staffed by smiley staff members. The room was quite small, but large enough to cope with for just a few nights, but as the city was so close we hardly spent any time in there anyway. The staff were helpful, offering advice about what to see and do, and happy to look after cases after we checked out and went to get some lunch. Would stay here again.

The hotel is in a very good location, just off a main street in central Amsterdam, on a quiet canal street. It is a 3 star hotel which may account for the stained carpeting, thin towels, and some snooty reception staff. The breakfast, although a reasonable price, was consistently out of items, had stale pastries and funny tasting eggs. Some of the rooms are tiny, so try to request a large room, if the staff will indulge your request.
First time in Europe - good size room and bathroom, clean, lots of light, comfy bed what more could you want! Would stay again if went back to Amsterdam.

We spent 2 nights at the Rembrandt and found it to be comfortable and clean and in a fantastic location. It was quietly situated but within easy reach of everything we needed. Our rate included breakfast and a boat trip and staff were friendly and helpful. The room wasn't huge but for a 3* hotel in a central location it was great. We would definitely stay again.

We stayed at the Rembrandt Residence Hotel in April 2006. We found the hotel to be in a good location and our room was quite large. Bathrooom was also very big. We had a view of the canal which was wonderful although we could not figure out how to lock the windows. We were on the 2nd floor so it was not a problem. The staff was very pleasant and we enjoyed our stay. We would stay here again. We thought the breakfast was a little less than we expected.
entity_b_review: Awesome hotel next to Central Station? Must eat at sky lounge at top of hotel. It over looks the entire city. Perfect location to all tourist attractions.

Stayed for 3 nights for the football at Ajax hotel is in a great location for the train station and the Metro which you can take direct to the stadium, hotel even sells metro tickets. room was great, Apple tv is fantastic and the bed is the most comfortable i have ever had whilst staying away. staff all very helpful, will definitely stay there again.

I stayed in this hotel for a weekend break and was very impressed. The hotel is lovely, very stylish with fantastic views (we had a room on the 7th floor). The location is ideal - only minutes from town.

Just back from a short trip to the doubletree for my husbands 30th birthday, what a lovely hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful and rooms were modern and clean, also plenty of choice at breakfast time. We visited the sky lounge on the 11th floor, it had a nice chilled atmosphere but we only had one drink there as it was VERY expensive!! All in all great hotel in great location, would not hesitate in staying there again.

This is an excellent hotel, central for everywhere in Amsterdam Rooms are lovely, but even with an upgrade they are still small. Lovely White Company toiletries. We had a lovely view and the balcony is a bonus. Breakfast is fantastic. You wont need to eat till teatime. Will def re-visit.

We spent 2 nights at the mint hotel/ doubletree by hilton. All I can say is that the rooms were suberb. Very friendly staff at reception and breakfast was a delight. Unfortunately, room service needs to improve as our expectations were not managed. Food took longer to arrive and had to keep chasing. Also we were told that the kitchen is closed after 45mins of putting our order. However, the rooms and freindliness of the reception/ breakfast team make up for it. Extremely good value for money and will stay there again.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 day visit to Amsterdam. The location is very good, being right next to Central Station, but can be a little far from some of the tourist spots such as the Museums, Leidseplein and Jordaan. The hotel itself is very well presented, and staff very polite. However, on one day we left the room at around 10am and returned at 4.30pm to find that the room had not yet been cleaned (even though we had left the 'clean me' tag on the outside of the door). We had to ask at reception 3 times for the room to be cleaned, and over and hour and a half later it eventually was. The towels that we were promised immediately upon complaining turned up over 2 hours later. At no point were we offered anything to appease us, staff simply apologised and were ineffectual, although polite. This was disappointing, as apart from this, the stay was extremely pleasant.

We stayed at the Amsderdam Mint as had previously stayed at the Leeds Mint & enjoyed the experience. The Staff were very helpful & friendly, had made a note on booking form was our Wedding Anniversary + my birthday received a bottle of wine in room, also complimentary Continental breakfast each day. Hotel very central, more hotels being built nearby so maybe some disruption? Although we didn`t have any problems.

Summarization.comm: The hotel is centrally located, offering easy access to tourist attractions.

cont.entity_a: The hotel is excellently situated on a quiet canal street in central Amsterdam, within walking distance to major attractions such as Leidsplein, Dam Square, and Anne Frank's House.
cont.entity_b: The hotel is superbly located close to the Metro, train stations, and Central Station.

Summarization.comm: The rooms offer great views and comfortable beds.

cont.entity_a: The rooms, while small, provide large bathrooms and wonderful canal views, making them adequate for short stays. The showers in the bathrooms posed safety concerns, being scalding hot and sometimes malfunctioning dangerously, although management addressed these issues when confronted.
cont.entity_b: Despite several requests for cleaning, the room was not always cleaned, but it remains stylish with great views from the balcony, offers excellent amenities including Apple TV.

Summarization.comm: The staff are friendly and helpful.

cont.entity_a: The staff displayed mixed behavior; some were very helpful and friendly, contributing to a positive vibe, while others appeared rude, snooty, uninterested, and less professional, highlighting a need for improved customer service training.
cont.entity_b: The staff at the hotel are consistently polite, very helpful, and friendly, though some guests reported delays in service without compensation.

Summarization.comm: Breakfast at the hotel is sometimes delayed.

cont.entity_a: Breakfast is reasonably priced but often runs out of items, with some food like pastries and eggs being of poor quality and tasting funny.
cont.entity_b: Breakfast at the hotel is highly praised.

Summarization.comm: The hotel offers good value for money.

cont.entity_a: This hotel is worth the money because the stay was exceptional, and it's so great that you'll likely want to stay again.
cont.entity_b: The hotel is a favorable choice for special occasions like birthdays, and many guests expressed a desire to return.
Towels and room service were frequently delayed, affecting the overall guest experience.

The drinks at this hotel are quite expensive, but the sky lounge on the top floor is really good, definitely a must-visit, offering a comfortable setting ideal for celebrating birthdays and despite being pricey, it is highly recommended.

entity_a_review: Our room was very nice, and the service was excellent. We felt like this was a real bargain, especially regarding the location in the center of "the quarter", yet it was easy to find. The room was clean and well arranged. Valet parking is really required.

We stayed at the Hotel le Marais for four nights and loved it. This modern, boutique hotel was clean and well-maintained. The beds were heavenly! The one issue in the room was that the shower would spray outside the stall, leaving huge puddles on the floor, so we had to have the shower head practically facing the opposite wall to avoid the mess. The staff was extremely helpful, particularly Pierre, who booked several tours for us and got us $10 discounts per person per tour. The best part of the hotel is that it is in the heart of the French Quarters. This visit was all of our first times in Nola. Being able to walk to key landmarks, check out local art galleries and antiques, and grab a beignet was a huge plus! Other hotel perks: free drinks per guest, free bottled water in the room, 15% off our stay, and chocolates and ginger snaps in the lobby.

Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend 2012. I think this hotel is a steal if you catch it on an off-season weekend when the prices are lower. In any event, the rooms were really comfortable, though slightly on the smaller side. We were on the courtyard side of the building, and you'd never know you were steps from the mayhem on Bourbon. The complimentary breakfast was great, and the welcome drinks were a nice touch. Love the courtyard and pool -- very upscale feeling, but cozy and completely non-pretentious. One downside to this being a boutique hotel: there's no housekeeping after midnight, so we had to walk down to get the extra towels the housekeeper never left. Also we had a hard time getting the shower gels refilled, and had to call to ask for this to be done. But otherwise the service was outstanding, especially Shawn at the front desk. I will definitely stay here again and recommend this place to my friends.

Beautifully remodeled hotel in the perfect location. Very clean and very quiet - unbelieveable since it's only 1/2 block off Bourbon Street. The staff was excellent, the bar was a nice quiet retreat and the courtyard is charming. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to NOLA!

This hotel is in the very heart of the French Quarter. It is new, clean, and has good facilities. WiFi, breakfast, and a very well equipped business centre was free (normally charged for at other hotels), so I felt like I had good value for money. The staff were friendly and helpful. As this hotel has only just opened, there were a few very small teething problems in the area of service, but I am sure this will be sorted out in no time. I would definitely stay there again.

3 couples - friends for 30+ years, vacationing together for the first time. The hotel was fabulous - the rooms were clean and the beds were incredibly comfortable. The pool area was lovely and a wonderful way to end the evening. The location - perfect walking distance to everything. The staff pleasant and professional. My husband and I had been to the French Quarter 15 years earlier and we begged our friends to share this experience with us. Thank you for making this a most memorable experience for us.
Super breakfast included in price.. Great convenient location.. Hotel was clean--service outstanding.. Maybe need a little help retreiving car

The hotel is located less than one block off of Bourbon St in the heart of the French Quarter. The service was outstanding and the accommodations were clean and comfortable. It was a pleasure to stop after a full day on the road, enjoy some hot food and relax. The courtyard was very nice and relaxing. Everyone from the front desk to the general manager made us feel welcomed and comfortable. Well done!!!!
entity_b_review: Buyer Beware Stayed during a convention. It is as kindly as I can put it a dump. The rooms were horrid, poorly kept and bad condition. The mattresses, boxsprings and pillows looked as if they were purchased from a Katerina Auction. The service was comical and even though it states they serve breakfast they only serve coffee and pastries. Could not wait to check out.

Welcoming and friendly staff, elegant hotel I traveled to New Orleans recently was gratful that I stayed at the Ambassador Hotel. The staff was very welcoming and friendly and assisted me with every aspect of my travel, from directions to the local attractions - to recommendations for local restaurants. The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous, with antique brick walls and elaborate, lush curtains. My favorite part of the hotel (besides the amazing staff), was the location. It is located quite close to all of the major local attractions (the steamboat tours, downtown New Orleans, The French Quarter, etc).When I return, I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Had a Great Stay Just wanted to say that I had a great time at the Ambassador in New Orleans The rooms were great, housekeeping was great, very polite and Dave Smith the room manager was excellent with everything I needed. Hope to go back soon. Thanks

Got Bugs??? The room service advertised is a joke...unless you like greasy Mexican food. The cleaning in the rooms was horrible; barely vacuumed or dusted in almost 2 weeks of staying there and the bathroom was just barely cleaned everyday. The management is lacking and not too interested in customer service. My roommate was chewed up by some bugs in her bed and was left with huge welts that itched and oozed. Since it was booked through Expedia.com, there was nothing that they would do except take off the mandatory $4.95 phone surcharge (although that was pretty cool, since all local and continental long distance charges were included in that).It was a big disappointment from start to finish.

Great spot, great rate, great effort! Just returned from stay for French Quarter Fest. As we arrived, a bus was dropping off a full load of European students to stay at the hotel. Despite the sudden rush, we were checked in cheerfully and quickly. Everyone went out of their way. Location is great for getting to (or away from) Quarter craziness or Garden District, and Warehouse area has its own charm and eateries. Room was comfortable and quiet, if a bit dark. Bandito's off the lobby great for delicious breakfast with no wait (!) or tequila any time. We'd recommend the Ambassador to anyone traveling to NoLa for biz or pleasure...

Great old hotel in a great location I stayed at the Ambassador a week ago and had a wonderful time! I did have one of the infamous windowless rooms (the hotel is an old renovated warehouse of sorts) but the ambiance of the authentic New Orleans decor (exposed brick, high ceilings, wood floors) made it almost seem like being in old France. The hotel is located close to everything there is in New Orleans and a close stumble to Bourbon St. I found the valet staff to be prompt and friendly even though they were busy and the front desk staff was quick to attend to any request with a smile. I am definetly staying at this hotel next time I am in New Orleans, and I am curious to see how wonderful the renovations will turn out!

AMBASSADOR HOTEL, NEW ORLEANS Please be advised when booking at this hotel to request a room with a window. Ours did not have one and the door into the room was the only way out. Had there been a fire my husband and I would have been dead. I am wondering how these rooms ever passed code. The inexpensive rates and free parking were not bargain enough for the potential danger.

Once is Too Much If you enjoy fraternity house decor, you'll love the Ambassador. No extra charge for the beat-up furniture, lightless broom closet rooms and paper thin walls. Hotels like the Ambassador don't count on repeat business. There are much better hotel options in New Orleans.

Summarization.comm: The hotel boasts a perfect location, situated just half a block from Bourbon Street and within walking distance to all key landmarks, including local art galleries and antique shops in a quiet neighborhood, making it ideal for exploring the area's attractions.
The rooms are clean.

cont.entity_a: The rooms have super comfortable, albeit somewhat worn, beds, and are well-arranged, but issues with the bathroom showers spraying or leaking outside the stall can cause puddles on the floor, detracting from the overall comfort.
cont.entity_b: Some of the rooms in this hotel are windowless, in poor condition with basic and outdated furnishings, and suffer from subpar cleanliness, including reports of bed bug infestations, all of which indicate a need for significant improvement.

Summarization.comm: The staff is described as friendly.

cont.entity_a: The staff is outstanding, consistently described as helpful, professional, and providing excellent service overall, although housekeeping does not operate after midnight and there were occasional lapses in refilling amenities like shower gels.
cont.entity_b: Despite the management's clear disinterest in customer service, both the valet and front desk staff were efficient, friendly, and attentive, maintaining a positive attitude even when busy.

Summarization.comm: Breakfast is provided.

cont.entity_a: Breakfast is provided free of charge at the hotel, adding to the convenience and value of the stay.
cont.entity_b: The hotel's breakfast offering is limited to just coffee and pastries, despite claiming to serve breakfast.

Summarization.comm: The hotel offers a unique vibe.

cont.entity_a: Hotel le Marais is a new, clean, and modern boutique hotel that offers a memorable experience with its well-maintained and good facilities, upscale yet cozy and non-pretentious vibe, complemented by a lovely courtyard and pool, ensuring comfort and a touch of luxury.
cont.entity_b: The overall vibe of this hotel is great and authentically reflects the city's character, housed in an old historical building with genuine New Orleans decor. While it’s a neat and unique spot, being a renovated warehouse, the decor may not suit everyone’s taste.

cont.entity_a: The hotel provides thoughtful amenities such as free chocolates and ginger snaps in the lobby, along with complimentary drinks and bottled water in the rooms.

there are occasional oversights in service, such as the need to prompt the replenishment of shower gels, which can be addressed by contacting management. However, there are minor limitations such as no housekeeping services after midnight, and as the hotel is still in its early stages, there is potential for future improvements in service.
The hotel features a lovely and inviting pool area, perfect for relaxing, especially in the evening.
The hotel would benefit from offering valet parking to enhance guest convenience.

cont.entity_b: The hotel offers inexpensive rates, but the low cost is not enough to justify staying here, as the overall experience is lacking and potentially unsafe.
While the hotel provides free parking, this benefit is overshadowed by the presence of bed bugs and the overall poor condition, making it not worth the stay.

entity_a_review: Fabulous service, great location We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel River. The cheerful, personal touch and helpfulness of the staff (particularly Salvatore the concierge who gave great tips re restaurants) made our stay an absolute pleasure. The view of the river Arno from our terrace was beautiful and the location was just right - a short walk from the centre but far enough away from the attractions so as to be quiet.The room was quite small but comfortable and clean and had a nice bathroom and a great shower.There was free internet access in the hotel lobby.We would highly recommend the Hotel River and would definitely stay there again next time we visit Florence.

Nice and quiet Incredible little hotel away from the noise of Florence, but walking distance of only 10 minutes to city center. Great sized rooms and beautifully decorated. Very clean with decently sized bathrooms for Europe. Beds were very hard. Breakfast served beautifully and elegantly with many choices, based on basic Italian breakfast of pastries, cold cuts, cheese, hard boiled eggs (with cute little cups and spoons), fruit and real coffee! Very small staff works hard to meet every need. Great place to have a drink before dinner in the lobby or on the rooftop balcony with view of the Arno.

Nice hotel - great location Nice hotel in a great location on the Arno River. Rooms were large; bathroom was large compared to other places we stayed in Italy, and the A/C really worked! The staff was helpful and accomodating with maps, directions, restaurant recommendations, taxis, and laundry service. There is a booth in the hotel lobby with a computer with internet access. Don't miss gelato at Vivolo, near San Croce.

Small but perfectly formed A charming clean and comfortable hotel. Polite and helpful staff.A short walk (or inexpensive bus ride) to the historic attractions.The knowledgeable manager will tell you which buses go where as well as sell you the tickets. He also directed us to the shop selling the gorgeous room fragrance that was in our room.Standard breakfast in an enclosed terrace or in the elegant lower breakfast room. My only crticiscm is of the coffee, because I just prefer a pot at the table.

Great Hotel The Hotel River was a wonderful experience. It is a lovely European hotel with all the charm you would hope for. The location is good with a short walk to the action.The staff was very helpful and polite. Good breakfast. We would definitely stay there again!

Lovely hotel with pretty view of the river We stayed in this central hotel after changing from a dismal, allegedly three-star hotel. The room was pretty and clean, with a nice view of inner courtyard. Staff were friendly and very helpful, and we were close to all the main sights. The hotel balcony was lovely to sit around and watch the world go by and see the river below. I would recommend this as a good value, better than 3-star hotel and would visit again.

Great Hotel The River in Florence is a real find and probably was one of the best hotels that we stayed at on our trip. It is located across the street from the Arno in the San Croce area. Our daughter and I liked the location because this area of Florence was very clean and was away from the main hubbub of the city. There is a bus stop very close to the hotel. We arrived by train and took the number 13 to the hotel and the number 12 took us back to the train station. The staff is very accommodating and the reception area and breakfast area were very nice. The hotel also offerred free internet access.
A Room with a View       The Hotel River from across the Arno River...'immediately in front of the Duomo.
entity_b_review: Good location, but that's all. A great location, beside the road from train station and walking distances from Florence tourist attractions.The hotel is old little neglected and the rooms are small. The price is excellent but you get what you pay.

Don't recommend this hotel. The hotel is much older than the pictures on their website. Our room is facing to a construction site. The worst thing is that the construction site started to have someone hammering at 8 or 9am so I had to wake up by 8 or 9 am. The sound insulation was not good. The only thing that i like is the location. very convenient.

Well located good hotel We were a little apprehensive booking this hotel because of some negative reviews. We selected it because of its convenient location and price. Wewere pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and decent. The staff was very friendly and accomidating. The location is perfect if you arrive by train and all attractions are easily reachable by foot. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay in the city.
Whatever you do , DON"T STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!       The cigarette butts they left on the balcony

STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL This hotel has the most uncaring staff I've ever witnessed. Our hotel room was burglarized while we slept in our beds. No one was injured thankfully, but the hotel displayed a no-care attitude. They never sent a staff person up to the room when we called down to report the intrusion. They made us wait while they checked people in and out before giving us the insurance forms to fill out and made us wait once again while they copied the forms for us. They never apologized and basically treated us like we didn't exist. Stay away from this one - there's plenty of hotels in Florence.

Not a 4-star hotel. We stayed here as part of a group tour through northern Italy. Of the 21 rooms occupied by our group, at least 7 rooms had problems such as foul odors and non-functioning air-conditioning and the occupannts requested a room change. The first room we were given was tiny  the a/c didn't work. The room they gave us next was handicap-accessible and was much larger, with a huge bathroom. The bathroom, however, had no put-down space at all  we had to move a small table from the bedroom into it. The neighborhood is very seedy and we were uncomfortable walking around there at night. There are better choices in beautiful Florence.

Great little hotel We stayed in a triple room for 4 nights april 10 -14,the hotel was great very clean and the staff very helpfu,had no problem with the area at all ,iit was very convenient as we were traveling by train,just cross the street and you are there,also the buses on the other side of the station to go to Fiosole,plaza Michelangelo and the discount mall outside of Florence.the breakfast was very good for that size hotel,we did not expect that good selection,the restaurant next door for a late dinner or snack is great.I will stay here again and really recommend it

Big deal It's an excellent option : very close to train station and city main attractions. If you don't want to spend so much, but need a clean and confortable hotel with a good breakfast, you can try this one

Summarization.comm: The hotel is centrally located and offers easy access to transport links and the city center.

cont.entity_a: The hotel is charming and European, situated on the River Arno in a quiet locale, offering beautiful views and a peaceful atmosphere away from city bustle.
cont.entity_b: The hotel's location is excellent, situated close to the train station, main attractions in Florence, and bus routes to Fiosole, Plaza Michelangelo, and a discount mall.

Summarization.comm: The rooms are clean and well-decorated.

cont.entity_a: The rooms are spacious, especially compared to other hotels in the area, and feature fully functioning air conditioning and large bathrooms. They provide beautiful views, though some guests found the beds to be incredibly hard.
cont.entity_b: The rooms at this hotel are generally small, with some facing a construction site; while they are clean, the sound insulation is lacking, making them feel unsafe, and the view isn't the best, though the handicap rooms are somewhat larger.

Summarization.comm: Staff service affected hotel stay

cont.entity_a: The staff at the hotel are extremely friendly, polite, and hardworking, including a knowledgeable manager who offers valuable local outing advice. The team is small but very helpful in accommodating guests' needs, such as providing directions, arranging taxis, or recommending restaurants.
cont.entity_b: The staff generally displayed an unprofessional and uncaring attitude, with reports of being unhelpful during check-in and check-out, and failing to apologize after incidents, which significantly impacts the quality of service perceived by guests.

Summarization.comm: breakfast is available

cont.entity_a: Breakfast at the hotel offers a surprisingly good selection and a lovely variety of foods, consistently praised for its quality and variety.
cont.entity_b: While the dining experience at the hotel's restaurant received mixed reviews, the affordability of the hotel was appreciated by some guests, indicating a balance between cost and quality.

cont.entity_a: Internet access is freely available, with a computer provided in the lobby and a booth terminal for guests' use.
The hotel features a balcony and a rooftop with views of the Arno, perfect spots for relaxation and enjoying the scenery.
You can also have a drink in the lobby before going to dine.

cont.entity_b: Noise issues are a common complaint, attributed to both external construction and poor sound insulation, potentially disturbing the peace of guests.
This hotel appears older than depicted on its website, which does not accurately portray the hotel's current condition.
For a cheap hotel, the quality isn't bad, overall, it's a decent place for the price.

entity_a_review: Travelled with a friend for a quick getaway. We were in a room with 2 beds, fridge, & micro(we were in room 403), room with views of Clark St. As always it was a great stay, staff very friendly, and willing to help in any way possible. If your not a continental b-fast kind-of-person, I would suggest The Golden Nugget one block south of Diversey on Clark.

This old Days Inn is in the heart of Lincoln Park and a short walk to Boys Town.The hotel was clean and the free breakfeast was a big hit. My only complait are the bathrooms. Time to upgrade! They all have this 3 inch step up which is just great to trip over at 3 am in the dark. Other then that this is a nice hotel.

Cheapest decent hotel in Chicago that I could find. Nice large room which was pretty modern looking considering the age of the building. Appreciated the free WiFi and the fact that you have to swipe your key to get on the elevator or stairs- extra security (though somehow the pizza delivery guy was able to get up to our room, must have an agreement with the hotel.) Street noise didn't bother me too much. Breakfast was great, although the room was a little cramped. The only complaint I have is that its hard to pull up to the front of the hotel to get valet parking ($22/24 hours) Great hotel.

I stayed here by myself the night before a group tour and got a single room, which came with a double bed. The sheets are soft and there four pillows on the bed! Awesome. The room is perfect for one or two people. The area is great, although not serviceable by the train, it has buses to the city. The area itself is really upbeat, with a young crowd. Great little shops, restaurants and bars. I'd stay here again for sure if I were in Chicago. It's a nice alternative to the large downtown hotels.

The staff at this hotel were extremely gracious and went out of their way to welcome me. I arrived early and the staff had a room cleaned and ready for me promptly. Property is located right in the heart of Lincoln Park and there are numerous dining and nightlife options at the property doorstep. I will definitely return to this property. The Days Inn brand gets a serious upgrade in my mind with properties of this character.

This was my first trip to Chicago and Days Inn made it even better! It is a great bargain especially for the location. The hotel was clean, the staff was so darn nice, the free bfast was mmm soo good- the muffins were amazing, fresh squeezed juice, and even make your own waffles. The only complaint is the drain in the shower wasn't working as smoothly as it should have been. I can't see how anything could go wrong here and even if it did, front desk was just so ncie!

We booked this hotel for a girl's trip to Chicago. I booked solely on written reviews....and boy were we impressed!!! For the price, this hotel is PERFECT!!!! The beds were great, rooms were very clean, breakfast was the best....waffles...YUMMY...and the staff was so helpful and friendly!!!! Great location to public transportation. Highly recommend this property!!!!!

I have stayed at this hotel several times over the past 15 years. It is quiet, clean, moderately priced, and very conveniently located near several bus lines. Clark Street, on which it is located, is a major shopping street, and there is parking at the nearby Century Mall. I have found the staff to be friendly and helpful.
entity_b_review: Extremely helpful staff, very convenient location, spacious and well appointed room. We surely would stay here again.

My husband and i have been staying at The Talbott for nearly 20 years and we love it! The location can't be beat, of course, and the rooms are beautiful, especially the spacious marble baths. The fluffy down duvets are delightful too. The ever gracious staff is what sets The Talbott apart from the rest. You will be warmly greeted at the door by the bellmen, then experience the same personal touch at the front desk and the concierge desk. People who are happy doing their job and personally connected to your excellent experience, that's the big deal. I am attaching a photo of Gene at the concierge desk, just one of the good friends you will also make at The Talbott hotel!!!

Much more than we expected, this hotel is gracious in every way. Suites are large, well appointed, with fabulous bathrooms. The staff, including the front desk, and the concierge were so helpful. A lovely, quiet and accomodating hotel, one of the very best! The Parkers

The Talbott is a great place to stay. It is a luxury boutique in the heart of the Gold Coast, easily within walking distance of Michigan Avenue, State Street, and Navy Pier. The staff is exceptionally friendly. They provide twenty-four-hour room service, concierge service, and the front desk staff and waitstaff are even cheerful late at night. The rooms are modern, well decorated, and comfortable. They feature flat-screen sattelite televisions, ihome alarm clocks, and many other conveniences one would expect from a luxury hotel, without the sameness of the chains.

We were advised by a friend about this hotel. We were travelling with a nother couple. old friends, and we were delighted with this hotel. The staff were extremely courteous and friendly, the rooms were excellent, and the service efficient. It is a great location, and we would recommend it to our friends.

My wife and I just spent 3 nights at The Talbott. The room was spacious, comfortable and well-appointed. The hotel is quiet although there is some construction nearby. Linens and towels first-class. Free Wi-Fi in the room. The location is terrific, just one block to Michigan Avenue. We will stay here on future visits.

We stayed 5 nights at the Talbott which was in easy walking distance of the Hancock Tower, Millenium park, Sears Tower etc. Staff were friendly, and helpful. Menu was varied but limited. Numerous Restaurants nearby, avoid Gibsons as very expensive. We had large comfortable Room with walk in wardrobe, well equipped bathroom with his and hers toilet rolls and basins. Not cheap, but central and not as expensive as the Water Tower next door.

In a word - NOISY. A new hotel is being constructed out back. They start at 8 a.m. sharp and don't end until late at night. Every Day. I'd wait until it's done before staying there. If you only need one bed, they can move your room to the front of the hotel where it's not as bad. If you need more than one bed, though, you're out of luck. The hotel is nice, restaurant has very good food and otherwise the stay was fine.

Summarization.comm: The staff are consistently amiable and helpful.
The rooms are spacious and modern.

cont.entity_a: The rooms are consistently cleaned to a high standard, featuring double beds that are great for one or two people, with soft sheets, plenty of pillows, and additional amenities like a fridge and microwave; although the building seems old, the rooms are surprisingly well-maintained, with the only minor issue being the shower drain that needs some attention.
cont.entity_b: The rooms in this hotel well-decorated, and extremely spacious, offering a high level of comfort with essential amenities and luxurious features such as flat-screen satellite TVs, iHome alarm clocks, and lovely down-feather duvets. The bathrooms are equally impressive, well-equipped, and one of the highlights of the stay. Free Wi-Fi is also available in all rooms.

Summarization.comm: The hotel is conveniently located near various attractions.

cont.entity_a: The hotel is conveniently located on Clark Street in the center of Lincoln Park, surrounded by numerous restaurants, bars, and vibrant nightlife, with easy access to bus routes into the city and major shopping areas, including the nearby Century Mall which offers parking.
cont.entity_b: The hotel is located in a quiet area on the Gold Coast, conveniently near Michigan Avenue, State Street, Navy Pier, Hancock Tower, and Sears Tower, making it an ideal spot for accessing major attractions and numerous restaurants.

Summarization.comm: Free Wi-Fi is available throughout the property.
The hotel offers breakfast.

cont.entity_a: The hotel offers a great breakfast that is not only good but also super tasty.
cont.entity_b: The hotel’s dining options were limited, with a small variety of food items to choose from. Although the menu offered a range of cuisine types, the overall selection was quite restricted.

cont.entity_a: The hotel is ideal for a boisterous and young crowd, providing a lively atmosphere suitable for activities like a girl's trip.
The hotel has good security, as your key card is needed to access the elevators or stairwells, providing added peace of mind and ensuring guests feel secure during their stay.
Parking is challenging, particularly for valet services at the front of the hotel, although nearby Century Mall offers parking solutions.
While there is some street noise, it is generally not disruptive enough to cause concern, maintaining a balance between a lively location and a restful stay.

cont.entity_b: The hotel is quite expensive, but despite the cost, it offers a fairer price compared to other hotels in the area. Additionally, a new hotel is currently being built nearby.
The hotel is currently undergoing expansion with a new building, which may affect the overall tranquility for some guests.

entity_a_review: This one is easy. Go there, try to make it to a table without slipping on the (signature) peanut shells on the floor. A Singapore sling (comes in several flavours) is 26 SGD plus 17 percent. The place is normally crowded, yes there is even a queue at the door at times. The place is full of tourists, Americans are there in large numbers. The toilets around the corner are totally out of character with the Raffles hotel in particular and Singapore standards in general. Hence try to avoid them. The hotel is very neat, the beautiful reception is closed to non-guests and the restaurants of top class. The Long bar is there for tourists and the profit only. It could as well be closed as it no longer has anything to do with the hotel as such.

What’s not to like about the Raffles Hotel Singapore? The staff is almost perfect in their service and attentiveness. The rooms are exquisite. The hotel is gorgeous and a nice oasis in the midst of an urban landscape. It’s a beautiful place with an appropriately high-class staff that gives excellent recommendations for restaurants, tourist information, and navigating the city. We think everyone deserves to stay here at least once in his or her lifetime.

Very disappointed with the afternoon tea in the Tiffin Room. The sandwiches had been made for hours and the bread was very dry. Not much selection of other food. Must say the service was excellent and all staff at the hotel were pleasant. We stayed at the Fullerton Bay Hotel and are sorry now that we did not partake of their aftenoon tea service, but Raffles being Raffles, we thought it was going to be "the tops".

Bed was super comfy, c, water power is strong - something which I miss in some hotels. Room was also equipped with DVD player - it was useful one afternoon when it rained so hard so we spent the time watching films. Other than that, the rest of our stay was wonderful and we'd surely come .
Bit pricey but loved it, rooms amazing so many service buttons didnt know which to press would stay again in a flash on any special occasion
The Spa is out of this world. Expensive but fabulous. Restaurants are great. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed.
The hotel is well located, Very beautiful rooms, good breakfast & location. The staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful.

I did a tour with Tour East which included High Tea at Raffles Hotel. I had been told it was great but had to do it to find out how good! I would recomend it to any one that asks! I also did the Tour East Tour that included a Singapore Sling at Raffles, I opted out of the Singapore Sling for $29.50,Thought it was over priced. I can understand some one who says having the Singapore Sling as a memorable experience, to note as having done it. Tick it off as been there done that. I can say the same as having just experiencing the aura of The Long Bar and treading on peanut shells as an experience in itself. Can recomend to anyone thinking of doing these tours or others with Tour East. Very professional group Thank you for a wonderful holiday.
entity_b_review: As a regular business traveller to Singapore I always look forward to staying at the Shangri-La. Great service, attention to detail and the ever present taxi-hailer - make it feel like coming home. Rooms are spacious and comfortable with quiet aircon and welcoming tea and fruit. Room service is of a good standard and reasonably priced. One improvement could be to remember details such as non-smoking preferences - I had to really push for the hotel to move me to a non-smoking room, which they did have available, though at a higher level. Given i was checking in at midnight, for just one night, I really was disappointed that I had to push - who else would have taken the room at that time! That said, generally no complaints and a great hotel with a few extras that you don't always find in Singapore.
What a wonderful atmosphere and a great room for a great price. The breakfast buffet was out of this world. The room was gorgeous. Service was exceptional.

Spent 2 nights at this fabulous hotel during a recent business trip. Excellant service and staff. Rooms are large and standard of cleanlines is very high. Wifi access free throughout the hotel with great connectivity. Hotel is within walking distance of the Orchard Road shopping area, however I believe the hotel also offer a free shuttle service. Hotel has a gym and swimming pool. Buffet breakfast was great, with a huge choice and fresh products. As my departure flight was at 11pm, the hotel allowed freshing up in the health club, with towels etc provided for shower. Would definately return to this hotel for both business and pleasure.

You have to love the far east. The hotels are the best in the world and the Shangri la is up there amoungst the very best, From check in to the room every thing was seamless and calm. This is a word "calm" that i would use to describe the Shangri la a lot. The subtle touches like the changing of the carpet in the lift showing the day of the week, to cold water and iced face towels around the pool. Service cannot be faulted and the old world touch of kneeling to serve although a shock to someone from the west was done with such style and grace you grow to enjoy the gesture.

Fantastic hotel - wonderful rooms, great beds, fruit in the room every day, extensive gym....could not have asked for more. A few minutes walk from Orchard Road so when I wanted to do a bit of shopping it was close but far enough away to not hear the noise. The gym and LINE restaurant were WONDERFUL. I will definitely stay here again - perfect for my business trips to Singapore.

All the good points have been made in previous reviews but I would like to just emphasise how good the service is here. I stayed in the Valley Wing and, though very expensive, the free afternoon tea, canapes and drinks go some way to mitigating against the high cost. The eggs benedict for breakfast was the best I've had and the Singapore Sling was far better at the Shangri La than the ready mixed mediocrity being served at Raffles. It isn't as centrally located as some hotels but taxis are pretty cheap and it's worth a few minutes in a taxi if it means you can stay at such a wonderful hotel.

We tacked on 5 days at the Shangri La staying in the Garden Valley wing at the end of our SE Asia Honeymoon and I cannot praise it highly enough, the garden valley wing is an all inclusive break and it's free champagne (Moet) and high class food from 11.00 am till 10.00 pm. The rooms are spacious and luxurious and the staff are very attentive, a reasonable location and a much better option than the faded grandour of Raffles.

The Valley Wing at the Shangri-La is a must! Familiar atmosphere, the absolute friendly and warm staff members knew our name from the first day. In the Lobby all Champagne (Moet Chandon) is free, you will get a glass even when you wait 3 minutes for a taxi... Service is Top-end, nothing to do better. Rooms are beautiful and large, garden and pool-site are very relaxing, so I spent most of the afternoons in the pool with our baby-daughter. If you go to the Shangri-La, book the Valley Wing! Enter the Lobby, sit down, relax and sip your Champagne... Thanks a lot, Achem!!

Summarization.comm: This hotel is recommended for both business and pleasure.

cont.entity_a: This hotel is the best choice for staying and is absolutely beautiful. Typically, there are many guests at the hotel as it is very popular. It's a very popular hotel with crowds and queuing at the door.
cont.entity_b: This was a great stay, ideal for those seeking a few extras that aren't typical of most hotels in Singapore.

Summarization.comm: The staff provided excellent service with a friendly and helpful demeanor.
Breakfast options are available.

cont.entity_a: The hotel's food selection was limited and lacked freshness, with overall disappointing offerings, and while the restaurants were mostly great, the afternoon tea left a lot to be desired.
cont.entity_b: The breakfast options at the hotel are great, featuring a buffet-style selection that includes a huge choice of fresh and tasty food, with rave reviews for the Eggs Benedict. Additionally, the afternoon tea and canapés were really nice and appreciated.

Summarization.comm: The rooms in the hotel are comfortable and cleaned to a high standard.

cont.entity_a: The rooms in the hotel feature a super comfortable bed and strong water pressure in the bathroom, equipped with a DVD player, which proved really useful during rainy days, but the toilets around the corner are below Singapore standards.
cont.entity_b: The rooms in the hotel are absolutely amazing, spacious, and luxurious, feature quiet air conditioning, providing a comfortable and stunningly luxurious stay, as well as welcoming tea and fruit, in all rooms.

cont.entity_a: The hotel has a unique tradition of having peanut shells on the floor, which, while part of the experience, can be a slipping hazard.
The hotel is beautiful and, despite being expensive, is considered worth every penny due to its stunning decor and top-class restaurant.

cont.entity_b: The hotel, situated close to the Orchard Road shopping area, isn't exactly central but is within walking distance of major shopping locations, offers a free shuttle service, and is only a short, inexpensive taxi ride away from other areas of interest.
The hotel along with unique touches like a changing carpet that reflects the day of the week.
The hotel offers a gym for fitness needs and features a swimming pool, with additional comforts such as cold water and iced face towels available around the pool area.
Free Wi-Fi access is provided throughout the hotel.

entity_a_review: The only complaint I have with this hotel is that the buffet breakfast, which was included in the price of the room, was lousy. Watery scrambled eggs, pay extra for a cappuccino, bacon that died two days ago - apart from that though, a great hotel with terrific service. A short walk to the Eaton Centre and Yonge Street. A good diner/grill/bar across the road. Despite the breakfasts, I'd stay there again.
Staff was very helpfull with directions around the city. Location was fine , We had no problems with anyone in the area despite what other people have said in their reviews.

I took a quick 3 day weekend trip to Toronto (my first trip there) with friends to see a ballgame and the Hockey Hall of Fame and take a quick tour of the city. The staff at the Grand was very friendly, helpful and attentive. Feeling welcome is very unusual in todays mega-chain hotels, but the Grand was top notch in that respect. Any flaws that the Grand may have vanish thanks to the staff and many complimentry features. Excellent free breakfast buffet, nice indoor pool and jacuzzi, two rooftop jacuzzis and sitting areas (make sure you use them on warm summer night!) and free gym. Underground parking is expensive, $19.00 per night, but I was not charged. The neighborhood is very colorful, but if you want a sanitized version of a city, stay on the Las Vegas strip. You will feel safe anywhere you walk in Toronto, and Toronto is a city that should be walked to be experienced.

We were satisfied with our stay at this hotel. The service was very good, the hotel was clean, the breakfast was decent, and the rooms were just fine. The hotel is in a not great area, but I felt safe, nonetheless. A bit outside of the city center, but the hotel itself is nice and it is close to a subway station, as well as a trolley line. Don't bother renting a vehicle, you won't need it! Also, the hotel offers a shuttle to sites within the downtown district. The swimming pool is very nice, and the roof space is very nice with plenty of seating and the hot tubs were great. The staff were attentive and very gracious. I would definitely stay here again.

Liked the hotel, the rooms, the pool, the hot tub on the roof. Location close to everything you need, but somehow the blocks surrounding the Grand Hotel are not the nicest area. I didn't feel safe there.

We stayed at the Grand hotel for 2 nights, and it was great. Our Junior Suites were clean, spacious, and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and accomodating. The location was excellent - steps away from the Eaton Centre and great shopping. We had a lovely complementary breakfast each morning including both hot and cold food. Complementary internet access was very useful in keeping in touch with family. We pretty much had the beautiful pool, whirpool, and locker room facilities to ourselves - also very clean. I will definitely be staying at the Grand hotel again.

We got a great deal online for a nice room with a beautiful view -- the small suite with a foldout couch was perfect for our family of four. The hotel staff was pleasant, knowledgeable and helpful, with lots of tips for getting around. The location is not excellent -- it's on the outskirts of downtown, and the neighborhood is a bit scary even for those of us from other large cities -- but the hotel provides a free shuttle, and we were able to walk to restaurants and shopping without a problem. The pool room was hot and overchlorinated but adequate to calm down the kids before dinner. All in all, a nice stay, and we'd go back.

I have just returned home from my Canadian Getaway. The hotel is fantastic and we have never experienced such incredible service before. Our room always looked spectacular, and the front desk staff was always extremely helpful. We ate a couple meals at the hotel which were both great. I would recommend this restaurant and hotel to anyone travelling into Toronto or that even live in Toronto! I've visited Toronto many times and love the city, yet i've never wanted to stay in the hotel so much before. The roof top was beautiful at night or in the day. If you want to mix a little luxury with the odd trip to Toronto then this Hotel is an absolute must.
entity_b_review: An upgrade to an enormous suite, fresh fruit and workout clothes waiting for me, 5pm check out, free shuttle to city airport. Very Royal indeed!
The service was impecabble! But the room.... The rooms are very small and DIRTY. You can see dust everywhere!!

This review is a little late I know, however we have beeen constantly travelling since our stay in early Sept. I note all the other reviews regarding dated property and poor hotel standards and I also note the constant apologies from Hotel Management, however with so many poor reviews why don't they fix the problems, then they wouldn't have to keep apologing. I won't repeat all the comments from so many poor reviews other than so say, that was our experience as well. For the price, poor hotel, poor value for money, there are better options in Toronto.

We stayed at this hotel on 9th Aug for three nights..It is superbly located in the tourist area of Toronto. We were made to feel special from the moment we arrived in the hotel.We stayed on the gold floor with breakfast included this was outstanding we would highly recommend this hotel for a truly fantastic first class hotel in Torronto.

Stayed one night because of the hotel's convenient Porter Airline shuttle available outside the hotel's door. Staff was attentive and helpful, however the lines for the Concierge were long. Lovely restaurants in the hotel and there is an underground mall under the hotel. The hotel is a little expensive and parking is very expensive but the location is terrific. Rooms are small but comfortable. Hotel is large and hallways are very long. Only complaint, typical of expensive hotels, you must pay $16 for internet access.

I read many negative reviews after I made a non-refundable reservation for two nights. SO...I took all the negative comments to heart and when I checked in, I specifically asked for a refurbished, quiet room. Supposedly there are some rooms with antiquated furniture and lots of noise, I waited a few hours to check in, but the room was very nice, small, but nice flat screen tv, modern furniture, comfortable king-size bed and no noise even though we were near the elevator. I also got a coupon for free appetizer and $50 food and beverage credit. Everything in the hotel is expensive and Canada has a ton of tax on everything but the food was good and the place is gorgeous but be aware, parking was $42 a night. Absurd.

Located in heart of downtown near financial district and train station. Historic hotel with grand lobby and lots of atmosphere. Rooms small but clean and comfortable. Service good, excellent concierge. Can be pricey, try to get a deal online, worth about 150 to 250 per night depending on time of year and size of room you get.

Stayed at Royal York for 3 nights at start of a trans Canada tour. The lobby etc. of the hotel are very grand and imposing and well worth seeing, Our room was the smallest one of any of the hotels we stayed at during trip, although it had the normal two large beds, there was not a lot of room around them. Dark furniture and small window did not add to the rooms appearance. Having said this we enjoyed our time here but if we ever return to Toronto will try somewhere else.

Summarization.comm: The staff are friendly, helpful, and attentive, providing excellent local recommendations.
The hotel is conveniently located near major shopping areas and tourist spots.

cont.entity_a: The hotel is ideally situated on the outskirts of downtown, close to the Eaton Centre and Yonge Street, although the surrounding area is not ideal.
cont.entity_b: The location is excellent, ideal for sightseeing.

Summarization.comm: Internet access is available.

cont.entity_a: The burden is somewhat alleviated by complimentary internet access.
cont.entity_b: Internet access requires a fee of $16, which is a significant drawback for many guests.

Summarization.comm: The rooms are generally clean and comfortable.

cont.entity_a: The rooms at the Grand Hotel  ensuring a pleasant stay.
cont.entity_b: The rooms at the hotel are fairly small and vary in cleanliness; some are a little dirty while others are very clean, featuring large, comfortable beds.

Summarization.comm: The hotel offers dining options, including breakfast.

cont.entity_a: The hotel's food options, including a buffet breakfast with hot and cold dishes, are generally okay, though some guests noted the breakfast could be disappointing.
cont.entity_b: The restaurants at the hotel offer brilliant dining experiences with excellent quality breakfast.

cont.entity_a: The hotel features a nice swimming pool with hot tubs and locker room facilities, as well as a scenic rooftop area with plenty of seating.
Parking is notably expensive at $19.00 per night for underground access.
the feeling of safety is present despite what other reviews have said.

cont.entity_b: The hotel is grand, giving a royal vibe with a charming and atmospheric environment, especially noted in its large lobby.

entity_a_review: Hotel was clean, spacious, good location and good value for money. Only criticism I would say is that it's right next to the fire department, therefore can be a little noisy at times, certainly not enough to stop me coming back. Overall, very good.

I was in Chicago for a meeting and I was staying in Hampton Inn and Suites for one week. It it very close to Michigan Ave (Magnificent miles) less than 5-10 min walking, very close to the subway. Everything was perfect. So If I come back to Chicago I'll stay there

The hotel was great - clean, attractive, comfortable. It's in a terrific location. The staff went above and beyond - friendly, welcoming, knowledgeable, and just very very nice. They were all wonderful - we particularly enjoyed speaking with Janita Walton. We would definitely stay there again.

1. Neighborhood is great and safe. 2. Lots of local bars a couple streets over on Wells and Clark all the way up to Chicago Ave. 3. Every employee greeted us nicely, not a negative person in the place! 4. 160 a night more than I'm used to but had a free night coupon so helped 5. Breakfast included to get the day going 6. I would stay here again, we had a great time!

We got to the hotel early in the morning and they let us check in at aronud 9 am. It is a block away from the Grand Train Station (red line), so you can get anywhere from there. The room was so clean and comfortable. The complementary breackfast buffet is really good. The employees have excelent knowledge of the nearby good restaurants. It was a pleasant stay.

The hotel staff were very friendly and competent . The hotel is clean and our room was fine. The location of the hotel is good, it's about a 2 block walk to the red line subway. Breakfast is served from 6-10AM. The breakfast bar is very popular with families. If you plan to eat after 8AM be prepared to deal with a swarm of children.

The hotel suites are very large considering you are in downtown Chicago. Our king suite had a full size refrigerator, stove, microwave oven, and dishes. They provided free breakfast, and free coffee and tea 24 hours a day. The location is very convenient and a couple of blocks from Michigan Ave. The rooms need a little remodeling, though, but are clean and comfortable.

We have just spent 4 great nights at this hotel. My wife is in a wheel chair and the room was fully accessible, the bath is even wider in the middle so you can turn round in the shower. All the staff were very friendly and the doors were always opened for us before we got there, even when it was snowing like mad - Thanks everyone. You must visit the Rock Bottom Brewery just around the corner - the burgers are great and huge, the main courses are elegant and sophisticated and the carrot cake is big enough to use as a building brick - but a lot tastier!! BUT the main attraction is the great beers available all local brews and tasting great. Again would recommend this hotel to everyone, they were still filling up the breakfast racks with 5 minutes to go (Finish -10 am weekdays, 11 am weekends), and fresh coffee is always available in the breakfast room.
entity_b_review: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt - had a nice room (paid for an upgraded water view, which was nice to have), the staff was friendly and helpful, the location is perfect and we had a very decent rate. The lobbies were pretty nice, but we didn't hang out there or eat at any of the places. We walked most places (or took a cab if our destination was really far), even in the middle of winter. I try not to be too picky about these things, but our room was dusty the whole time we were there. It was enough to be noticed, so it should have been cleaned by the staff. Also, we weren't very fond of the bed. It was a bit on the hard side and wasn't exactly plus. It wasn't horrible though. Again, not horrible, but our room was very hot no matter how we set the temp at.

The Hyatt is recently remodeled and very nice. The staff was extremely friendly and always helpful. The location is centrally located on the mag mile and we could easily walk to all there was to do downtown. Will definitely stay here again. Classy but not stuffy.

I stayed two nights on business. The location was great and the room was very nice. The price was $25-$30 cheaper than any comparable hotels in the area. I had two minor complaints. The closet door was off the track, and wouldn't open when I checked in, and they didn't fix it the second day. Also, the Big Bar closed early, and the bartender was not very polite about letting me know before last call. Other than that, I would highly recommend the place.

We loved our stay at the Hyatt Regency. I really don't think there is a better location in downtown. So conveniently located off the river and a short jaunt to Michigan Ave, Grant Park, and Navy Pier. I have already recommended this hotel to other travelers heading to Chicago. I would say, however, the dining in the hotel is pretty pricey. So, if you are looking to save a few bucks get outside of the four walls of the hotel. That being said, I will still always stay at this hotel when traveling to Chicago, with out a doubt.

Overall the hotel is ok, very busy and noisy. Valet parking is the only choice you have and an additional $50 for every 24 hours. Valet parking stole our Ipod so they told us to fill out a claims report which we did and then we had to wait more than a week to call the claims department because the one and only person they have working claims was on vacation. Once I was able to talk to the claims department she was no help at all. She basically called me a liar and we will not be getting reimbursed for the loss of our IPod. I am furious that it cost me $50 per day extra and then we will have to pay another $250 + to replace our IPod.

I stayed here for two nights to partake in the Chicago St. Patricks festivities. Check in went super fast, and we were given a room the was so newly remodeled you could still catch a whiff of the fresh paint. It overlooked the river, which made for some great shots when they dyed it! Also, they allowed us a late check out of 2pm, at no charge, in order to not miss the parade. The beds were amazing, as was the bathroom. Plenty of space, with a very nice desk set up. And being one block from Michigan, and a 10 minute walk to Navy Pier, this is a great location. Couldn't have been more pleased with this hotel.

As a hotel, it's very nice, with very nice amenitiies, but it's also expensive. Canned soft drink in the mini-bar cost $4.25, and Internet use in the business center was something like $10 for 7 minutes (or was that $7 for 10 minutes?). Location is good. If price is no object, it's a good choice, but there are better bargains in the area.
Stayed there Feb 2005. A former jewel that has fallen into disrepair. The hotel is dark, and shabby. Even the newer wing is not up to par. If you stay in the Loop area, try the Burham instead.

Summarization.comm: The hotel is located near Michigan Avenue and has easy access to public transportation.

cont.entity_a: The hotel is located next to the fire station, which can be noisy at times, but the convenient location near the train station, Rock Bottom Brewery, and easy access to public transportation more than makes up for it.
cont.entity_b: The Hyatt hotel offers a prime location close to the river, Grant Park, and Navy Pier, making it ideal for exploring downtown Chicago.
