Summarization.comm: The staff is helpful and friendly, contributing to a pleasant atmosphere for guests.

cont.entity_a: The hotel offers a free breakfast buffet from 6AM to 10AM, which is a hit with families, along with free hot drinks available all day. The breakfast items are tasty, and guests can enjoy coffee and tea 24 hours a day. Additionally, the hotel is close to Rock Bottom Brewery, known for its great food, including burgers, carrot cake, and local beers.

cont.entity_b: The price of the hotel makes it a really good choice especially with the view overlooking the river.
The only available parking at the hotel is valet which can be costly.
The use of internet is costly.
The price of the hotel is generally considered reasonable by some, though others find it slightly expensive.

entity_a_review: I stayed at this hotel while traveling on business and it was by far the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. The second I walked in the room, I knew that I wasn't going to want to leave and ordered myself some room service. It has a very classic style with every modern convenience you could hope for. The bed is very comfortable and the fireplace makes it very cozy. It wasn't cold enough for me to really use the fireplace but I did anyway and cranked up the AC. The shower was also fantastic. I immediately declared that I needed to get myself a rainshower as soon as I was able! It is a pricey hotel but definitely worth it if you can swing it!

as local residents and first time guests, we found this hotel exceeded our expectations. staff were nothing but attentive and hospitable. our room was upgraded upon arrival; we couldn't have asked for more. this is a lovely hotel with not only luxurious amenities but superb staff. we can't wait to return!

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights over the Labor Day weekend, the same number of nights as we stayed in October 2007. An elegant, small hotel! The front desk and room service staffs, the concierges, restaurant and in-room breakfasts, and the chauffeured car service were all excellent. Our room (#407) was very elegant and quiet, was on the west side of the building, and had windows on 2 walls. Our only problem was that the sink taps were very tight.

My boyfriend has stayed here several times for business trips but this was our first leisure visit--service remains impeccable. Still received his personalized business cards and professional attentive service. Rooftop is a nice touch on a warn day to share a bottle of wine. Hotel car service was a great perk as well and we used it every night to go to our dinners around town. I am a huge product snob--the Lemon Sugar line from Fresh that they provide in the rooms has made me a regular user. And the location is perfect--within walking distance to everywhere. When it's colder out, we will return and use the fireplace in our beautiful room.

My wife and I stayed at the XV Beacon recently and from the minute we got out of our car (valet right at the entrance) to the minute we left the service/staff was exceptional. The rooms were beautiful and very clean and much larger than we expected from a historical building. There wasn't anything that had been left out, from the stereo playing when we entered the room to the weather report for the next day sitting on the night stand! The hotel is located right in the heart of Boston next to the Common and a few minutes walk to the waterfront, the possibilities are endless for restaurants and night life. We would definitely go back to this hotel, combined with the location we had a great experience!

We were on a business/leisure trip. It was a high star rating and deserved it. Around the corner from Boston Common, Fanueiul Hall, etc. Easy to get to city centre. The hotel breakfast was fantastic, if expensive. Every dish was amazing. When in Boston city, the Mapparium is worth a visit, along with the top of the Prudential building, to get a great idea of where everything is. There are some great museums to visit.
Favourite hotel in Boston. Modern luxury without seeming formulaic. Good for indulgent weekends in town.

I stayed a few weeks ago at this hotel and I heard everything! The walls are thin as paper as i heard every conversation from the room next door. I apprectiate that some builings in boston are older, but if you own a hotel you must do something ot soudnproof it!!!!
entity_b_review: Great location and greater service at this Hyatt in Boston. No more convient place to stay. Came in by train and never needed to have a car. You are right in the middle of everything! The hotel & service is top notch and this isn't my first stay in Boston!

When we booked this hotel we were worried because we saw more negative reviews than good at that time. I have no complainst...the staff was very helpful, the in house restaurant was excellent, the rooms were very clean. Very close to Macy's, TJ Maxx and Marshall's. . .walking distance to all other sites that we wanted to see. . . The only thing I can say negatively is paying for WIFI but that is a problem with all hotels.

Disappointing when hotels such as this still charge for wifi access. We didn't get notified verbally about the complimentary breakfast either although it was no doubt in the fine print somewhere. Rooms were nice and clean although a little boring and the bed not that comfortable. Can't fault the location, it was very easy to get anywhere with the subway station a few hundred metres away.

We stayed here for business. It was in a great location, close to the theater district, shopping, etc. There is only one restaurant and a very small bar in the hotel. It would have been nice to have additional options. There were restaurants close by, but again, it would have been nice to have had the convenience of additional dining places. The fitness center was so so. I was very disappointed that there was a charge for internet. When paying the price we paid per night, that should have been included in the room cost. Great concierges.

hi, i have read all the reviews and they are a bit mixed.We have just stayed there n i have to say it 's great.Its a central location - we hired a car and left it back 4 days early as parking is so expensive-unless u have to dont hire a car-otherwise park it in the place out in front of the hotel its the cheapest we checked them all i have the sore feet to prove it!

I stay at this hotel very frequently, and every single time, my experience has been fabulous. The hotel is right in the downtown area and 5 min. walk from South Station which really helps me as I frequently take the train from/to New York. The rooms are really nice, bathrooms and linen really clean and above all else, the staff is some of the most friendly I have ever come across, rifht from the front desk to the concierge and housekeeping. Samir Boukhari, the front desk manager is delightfully courteous and has always gone out of his way to help and make my stay very comfortable every single time. Dianna, Aruna and Lexi at the front desk and Anthony with the concierge are wonderful as ever. I would stay here as long as business/pleasure keeps taking me into Boston.

We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Boston for one night during Memorial Day weekend. The staff was great, we were upgraded to a Terrace Suite when we checked in. It was beautiful and very clean/pleasant, although you can't actually go out onto the Terrace so that was bittersweet. We ordered room service which was excellent! The breakfast buffet was wonderful as well! Great location to all of Boston. Overall a great trip! Will return to this hotel whenever we are in Boston.

I traveled here for business for the first time and was somewhat disappointed. There is only wireless internet service in most of the rooms, which I can not use with my office laptop for security reasons. I had to switch rooms in order to have high speed internet access... and the internet service seemed to work only some of the time. The connection wasn't working consistently and nobody in the hotel could help. They offered a toll free number for the tech people at the DSL company. The front desk failed to provide me with my mini-bar key and the mirror in the bathroom had a huge crack in it... There were many many tourists in the hotel, which isn't good for business travelers because they tend to make a lot of noise. I don't think I'll travel here again unless I am a tourist.

Summarization.comm: This hotel is a great place to stay, offering a convenient experience and justifying its price.

cont.entity_a: This is a superbly elegant and modern hotel with luxurious amenities that not only meets but exceeds expectations, thoroughly deserving its high-star rating.
cont.entity_b: This hotel is so ideal for repeat visits that it will be frequented over and over by its guests due to its cleanliness and convenience.

Summarization.comm: The location is excellent, making it easy to access the city center and nearby attractions.

cont.entity_a: Situated perfectly for Boston, within walking distance to major sights, which is very convenient for guests.
cont.entity_b: The hotel is beautifully situated close to the theatre district, Macy's, TJ Maxx, Marshall's, and other shopping centers, with easy access to the subway.

Summarization.comm: The rooms are clean.

cont.entity_a: This hotel features elegant and quiet rooms with comfortable beds and cozy fireplaces, but there is a lack of soundproofing.
cont.entity_b: The rooms are consistently praised for being nice and particularly noted for their adequate bathrooms and linens.

Summarization.comm: The staff are attentive and provide excellent service.
The food provided by the hotel is excellent.

cont.entity_a: Every dish tastes great, enhancing the overall dining experience.
cont.entity_b: The hotel features only one restaurant and a small bar, limiting food choices, and a complimentary breakfast is provided but not clearly advertised.

cont.entity_a: It is a little pricey however well-worth it because it exceeds all expectations.

cont.entity_b: WiFi access requires a fee, which has been a point of disappointment for guests.
The fitness center is available but described as not great or somewhat mediocre.

entity_a_review: Great place and location. Would defo stay here again. Loved it. Go see it.

The hotel staff was very helpful, rooms very modern with everything that we could think of. It is a short walk away from Gaudi's Casa Batllo, la Pedrera and a bit longer to la Sagrada Familia, the location couldn't be better! Within a couple of blocks it has many restaurants to chose from and can't forget to mention that it's in a great shopping area. From now on the place where we'll stay when visiting Barcelona.

Second time in this hotel and kinda disappointed. Rooms are ok and it is a good value for money mainly due to the great location on Paseig de Gracia, but the service does not seem to care so much about their customers. They are physically present behind the desk, but it stops here. It seems that they are breathing boredom. If you go to Barcelona for a short weekend and do not plan to spend too much time at the hotel, it'll be alright. If not, i'm sure you can pick a better place where the service will show you a more positive and customer focused attitude.

I have stayed here three times -all on business trips where the hotel was booked for me. In fact, there are many meetings held here, and so you might find yourself surrounded by a large group of businessmen - not necessarily a bad thing -but just be aware. The two lifts are small and infrequent, and so you may have to wait a long time - which is annoying if you are on the top floors. The location is great for seeing Barcelona -you can reach most of the central sights by foot -including the Gaudi cathedral. Very near to a metro line , which is also a bonus. Rooms are fine -just try to get one facing the courtyard at the back -the ones to the front can be noisy. Biggest disappointment was the breakfast -17€ for a very poor selection - definitely not worth it. I didn`t bother after the first morning.
This hotel is located in a great location however is very expensive. If your looking for a place near Gaudi's buildings and shopping areas, then stay here.

We got a really good deal on the rooms at this hotel and, therefore, it was worth what we paid for it. However, I would have been dissapointed if we had payed full price for this. We went in january which I know is not in season however, the terraces were closed and the pools were not open. They were also doing refurbishment works to one of the terraces, none of this was really communicated until you checked in. The room was a reasonable size as we had one at the end of a corridor and the bed was comfy. The bathrooms however, need some updating, they were tired and not in the best condition. Also be warned if you stay on the front of the hotel, the spanish like to beep their horns and this can be disturbing.

Great hotel! i can only think of a few things wrong with our stay, for one, breakfast was not worth the price paid and room service was a bit overpriced as well, but with such a wide variety of other places to eat in barcelona, it didn{t really mattter much. The standard room was small but then again the bed was huge! and the location... it can't get eny better!!!!
A lovely pillow menu...WOW..rooms excellent...location is very central and many many shops near the hotel, staff very helpful. A bit pricey but Lovely
entity_b_review: This hotel is situated at around 10 min by cab from the center (barrio gotico). Must be max 10 years old. Can be reached also by tram or metro. Rooms are clean, beds a bit hard. Bar is OK and the patio too but mostly in the shadom in the evening. Rooms that had a sea view don't have it anymore (see previous reviews). A bit expensive for the location and the lack of view (my room had a view on a skeleton building (crisis, what crisis?) on the side of the hotel, not charming at all). The pool on the 17th is not heated, so quite difficult to swim at this time of the year, nice view on the utility building on the other side and on the sea and beach, plus power plant for the rest.

I stayed in the diagonal zero for 4 nights while attending a congress. The area near the hotel is not nice, however, the metro station is nearby and you can visit the centre in a few minutes The rooms are spacious, mattress is moderate, views are poor. The decoration is modern but on the poor side. Breakfast was ok, but i consider it unacceptable to drink disgusting coffee from a machine in a 4 star hotel...it shows lack of respect for the client. The Personnel was very polite. There is a very good gym in the hotel and free wifi which is very important.

I stay for 3 nights in a business trip, the hotel is beautiful and the room was suburb. It’s far from the city town but have the beach nearby and a subway station pretty close. For sure I will come back again

The rooms and prices looked good and the pool looked attractive online, however the reality was different. I booked a family room which is really 2 separate bedrooms next to each other behind another door for privacy which was meant to lock but didn't. My kids room smelt like someone had smoked 100 cigarettes in it and had drugs and booze on the table when we checked in. They cleaned but the smell didn't go away for all 3 days and they would not change the rooms. The pool is tiny and over crowded with hardly any beds to lie on which is quite difficult with kids in a very hot city. Well done for offering free WiFi but making people check into your Facebook page every time is very irritating. Overall it is good value but it is most suited to weekend getaways for young party couples or mates.

We only stayed one night but had most of 2 days sightseeing in Barcelona with fairly grown up family in 2 bedrooms. Hotel happy to look after our luggage. Perhaps in an area a bit far from the character of Barcelona, but very convenient for tram and subway. Also large shopping centre close by with lots of dining choice. Pool a bit crowded as our trip was in the heat of August and slightly disappointing that they charged for towel use. Very helpful porter showed us control panel for lights/aircon etc - all very hi-tech.
We stayed for five nights at this hotel for a conference. By the end we couldn't wait to leave due to the monotonous breakfast, below par cleanliness, and cold decor.
Wonderful hotel just a short metro ride away from Barcelona attractions, with gorgeous rooftop pool. Excellent customer service.

Recently stayed here and was very impressed with this hotel. Friendly staff, good clean rooms and quiet so sleep no problem. The beach is with 10 mins walking distance from the hotel and 5 mins walk from a great shopping mall Diagonal Mar where there are lots of great restaurants. The metro is a 2 min walk and a 10 min journey or 6 stops to the centre of the city with no changes. We loved it!

Summarization.comm: The staff are helpful and enhance the overall guest experience.
The hotel is well-located for access to shops, major attractions, and public transport.

cont.entity_a: The hotel is exceptionally well-located in the heart of Barcelona, offering easy access to numerous shops, major attractions like Gaudi's Casa Batllo and La Pedrera, and it's also just a short walk away from the Sagrada Familia. Its proximity to several metro stations enhances its appeal, enabling quick and easy travel to and around central Barcelona. The central location is ideal for both sightseeing and shopping, as everything from cultural sites to retail experiences is within walking distance or a brief metro ride away.
cont.entity_b: The hotel is ideally located for shopping and dining, with a beach within a 10-minute walk and a subway station nearby, providing convenient access to central Barcelona and major tourist sites. However, it is relatively far from the traditional areas of the city.

Summarization.comm: The rooms are generally comfortable but vary in size and quality.

cont.entity_a: Standard rooms at the hotel are smaller than expected, largely occupied by the huge but very comfortable beds, yet they manage to provide a decent night's sleep. Despite their size, the overall comfort level is adequate. The bathrooms, however, consistently require attention; they are outdated and in need of both updates and a thorough cleaning. While the rooms on the small side can still be considered satisfactory, the best choice for a quieter stay are the rooms facing the courtyard at the back, away from the noise at the front.
cont.entity_b: The rooms are spacious but do not match their online descriptions, with some offering poor views and noticeable odors, including cigarette smoke. Despite being cleaned, there were unpleasant smells and even drug paraphernalia left behind. Although the rooms are generally comfortable, the misleading representations online and the lack of pleasant beach views detract from the overall experience.

Summarization.comm: The dining options are available.

cont.entity_a: The hotel is excellent and charming, though not cheap; it offers good value for a short stay in Barcelona despite being somewhat pricey.
cont.entity_b: The breakfast offered is considered average, with limited selection and complaints about the quality of machine-made coffee.

Summarization.comm: The hotel is perceived as expensive with concerns regarding value.

cont.entity_a: Despite having a lovely pillow menu, the hotel's breakfast is basic and expensive compared to other 4-star hotels, and unfortunately, it does not justify its high cost or offer good value for the price.
cont.entity_b: The hotel offers good value for the money spent, providing an impressive stay. It is especially enjoyable for guests attending business conferences, enhancing their experience with its services and amenities.

cont.entity_a: The lifts are small, infrequent, and can lead to long wait times, which might be inconvenient for guests, especially on higher floors.
Room service is priced on the expensive side.

Staying in rooms at the front of the hotel can be significantly disruptive due to the noise from street traffic and honking horns. It's advisable to request rooms facing the quieter courtyard at the back to avoid disappointment and ensure a more peaceful stay. Since the front side tends to be noisy at times, opting for a room that does not face the street is recommended to enhance your overall comfort and experience at the hotel.

cont.entity_b: While the hotel offers free WiFi, users are required to check in to the hotel's Facebook page each time they log in, which may be inconvenient for some guests.

The hotel is equipped with an excellent gym for fitness enthusiasts, but the pool, which is smaller than depicted in online photos, often becomes crowded. There is also a charge for pool towels, and seating around the pool is limited.

entity_a_review: Visited the Gaylord Palms this past weekend and was definitely impressed. Rooms extremely clean, staff very helpful, check-in was speedy, and activities to keep my son occupied for awhile. I definitely will be visiting again. Beautiful hotel, great staff and great location.

Our 1 bedroom suite was spectacular! Large bedroom and living room each with flat screen in HD. Wifi throughout the facility. Very clean resort. Beautiful atriums with fish, alligators etc. Daily feedings with question and answer periods. Many restaurants and bars located within. Only minutes from Disney. Golf nearby at Celebration with preferred rates when booked through the concierge. Nothing bad to say at all

The Shrek the Halls display was very cool (no pun intended). It's quite chilly, but very neat to see all the figures made of ice. The ICE attraction with the snow was very simple. Young children that have never seen snow would appreciate it,but that's about it. Our 9 year old was very bored. Thought the prices were quite expensive. Plus it's $13 to park...ugh!

Brought my mother to celebrate her b-day. Both restaurants where we dined were very good - cannot say enough great things about Old Hickory. The steak was one of the best I've had. The massage was terrific and you must wear their most comfortable robe back to your room. Highly recommend this hotel and would definitley stay there again.

Most rooms overlook an interior, glass covered courtyard which reminded me of the habitats you see at the zoo. If you are the spouse of a convention goer, you are trapped there. There is nothing to do but sit at the pool or work out if you don't want to go to Disney World. Even the chairs and benches are uncomfortable and designed to make you move on. I longed to find a window and look out at the real world.

I was lucky enough to be able to accompany my husband on a business trip to the Gaylord Palms Resort. We were thrilled from beginning to end. We pulled up to the magnificent resort and were delighted at the front desk with warm welcomes and friendly personalities from all. The front desk engaged us both in conversation and gave many tips on how I could enjoy the resort while my husband was working. Our room in the Emeral Bay section of the hotel was very clean and whenever we needed anything (toiletries, turn down service, directions) we dialed #88 on our room phone and were connected to friendly staff with all the answers! I explored resturants, the spa, and the pools and truly enjoyed my relaxing few days at this resort. I recommended this hotel to couples, families, business travelers, and soloists.

We loved the hotel and the grounds. We got an incredible deal on hotwire, so we couldn't beat the value. The service was excellent. We were traveling with two small children and they were very accomodating. The only complaint was that the food was very expensive. We were not traveling on an expense account and we had failed to rent a car, so our dining options were limited to the Resort. A simple continental breakfast cost us over $8--too much to spend on a bowl of cereal and a banana for a two year old. The restaurants were very expensive and we wound up ordering in pizza one night. But if you're on an expense account or have a car to get to the store (each room has a refrigerator) or to other dining options, this is a fantastic place to stay.

I have stayed at the gaylord Palms for the past couple of years for a yearly convention . I love this place and the friendly service we receive while there . I'm sure the prices are higher than other hotels , but I feel we get what we pay for . I do think the boat could be a little better as far as the food they serve . etc... . I look forward to this as a weekend spot every year for my convention and while I am only an hour away after the weekend we feel like we have had a mini vacation . I wouldn't change one thing about my stay except that I would love to be able to stay a week . I look forward to this years convention and the fun times my kids will have
entity_b_review: The "Hotel" is actually like something straight out of My Name is Earl. Filthy carpets, bugs in the refridgerator and all over the room. Horrendously misrepresented by the pictures on the website, the bbq area and lagoon are disgraceful. I paid for 2 star Quality, but would never stay here, recommend it, etc. In fairness the staff are very friendly and all issues raised were dealt with, they seem to know with the quality of their resort, they HAVE to provide good service. Bar is very reasonable, with Long Island Iced tea recommended. My honest advice, not even worth the small amount paid, I will never stay here again, you have been warned!!!

This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and both times have been totally trouble free. We stayed for 10 nights and had no problems. The room was clean and was cleaned every day, towels and bed sheets changed we came back every day to a spotless room. We only seen reception staff to check in and out but they seemed friendly enough and there were no additional charges over what we paid when we booked. The location is exellent, took about 10 mins to get to disney and about 20 mins to Universal and Seaworld. Aircon and tv worked well and there was always a parking space outside our room despite the hotel being quite busy over spring break. I will definatly stay here again if back in Orlando :)

This is one of my favorite hotels in Kissimmee. It is a Instead super comfortable, accessible parks and disney all the best places you can eat in your vacation. The attention is very satisfactory. I have two Sometimes visiting this hotel and will not be the last. since its price and the comfort of your rooms make your stay a very welcoming.
We stay here every year. I like the hotel, its clean, the employees are very nice and the prices are great. I will continue to stay here!

Is a nice hotel with many amenities, room service was excellent. The shuttle was not so confy, because run for 3 hotels, but Champions is the first so you can have a seat haha. If you have a car, fine, because if you don't have a car you don't have many alternatives to eat. I like this hotel and really recomend it. This hotel is near to a Chinese buffett, Dominos Pizza, Pizza Hut, Walgreens, McDonalds...
I had a lovey stay. The resort is a value, and taking the back road on Sherberth, I traveled to Disney in 6 minutes. The staff is warm and attentive. I felt like I was at home with family.

We were originally due to stay for 10 nights and we booked for three people - my teenager daughter and her friend and myself. On arrival in the room the beds were very small double beds and only two of them - I spoke to the manager who said that all the rooms were exactly the same (untrue) and that for an extra $10 we could have a rollaway bed. The rooms are far too small for more than two people. The site is not well maintained and the pool not clean. We were then stranded due to the volcano and having enquired about staying for an additional five nights was told that we could have a special price of $39 per night - only to find out on the website for the hotel that the cost for that period of time would be $32 per night. Scammed!!! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone - there are far better places to stay which are closer to the amenities.

Champions World Resort was exactly what we were looking for. A brief relaxing weekend near Orlando Fl. The rooms were nice and clean, and the hotel staff was very responsive and attentive to our needs. I highly recommend this resort.

Summarization.comm: The location is convenient for exploring local attractions and dining.

cont.entity_a: The location is ideal for exploring local restaurants and bars, contributing to a recommended stay for its convenience and attractions.
cont.entity_b: This hotel is ideally situated only 10 minutes from Disney and 20 minutes from Universal Studios and Seaworld, with major attractions and big chain restaurants all within a maximum of 20 minutes.

Summarization.comm: The staff are helpful and provide excellent service.
The rooms are equipped with a television and air conditioning.

cont.entity_a: The rooms are spacious and equipped with a high-definition flat-screen TV. They are always kept very clean, with toiletries provided upon request. The rooms in the Emerald Bay section are particularly well-maintained, with all necessary items readily available. The bedrooms are also spacious, with some overlooking a glass-covered interior courtyard. Each room includes a refrigerator and offers a clean environment, although the view is limited to the interior courtyard.
cont.entity_b: The hotel rooms are comfortable and affordable but not large enough for more than two people. Although the air conditioning works well, the rooms may not be clean, are quite small for more than two occupants, and have unclean carpets. Additionally, there were bugs in the room and the refrigerator.

Summarization.comm: The hotel's prices are higher than expected.

cont.entity_a: The food at the hotel, while quite expensive, does not meet the expected quality for the price, which has been a consistent point of dissatisfaction among guests.
The hotel features ice sculptures, with an ice sculpture display available for viewing.

The hotel offers a relaxing spa and several pools for guests to explore, along with a stunning atrium where various wildlife, including alligators and different species of fish, can be observed, creating a picturesque environment.

cont.entity_b: The BBQ and lagoon areas were both misrepresented, with the pictures on the website showing them in a much more positive way than they actually are. In reality, the BBQ was disappointing, and the lagoon areas were not up to an acceptable standard.
The beach is within a 10-minute walk, and there's easy access to a shopping mall and restaurants.
